Posts.Content: Amy_AZ wrote: I had my bilateral mastectomy on 6/21/12 and am still having trouble sleeping.  I can't lay down so am propped up with pillows and can doze for an hour or two but then wake up with alot of pressure in my chest and back pain because of the poor position I am sleeping in.  I have started to use a neck pillow which  has helped, but my back is still sore and then continues to bother me throughout the day.  Anyone else experience this and have good sleeping position tips or stretches/exercises that help?  Thank you! Posts.Title: Sleeping & sore back after surgery Amy_AZ ma111

Posts.Content: Amy_AZ wrote: I am 2 weeks post bmx & TE and am still having a hard time sleeping at night.  I sleep propped up with pillows behind me and one under my knees and after 1 to 2 hours I wake up with sharp pains in my chest that are hard to alleviate.  Getting up and walking around helps, but then the same thing happens 1-2 hours later which makes a good night's sleep impossilbe, LOL!  I assume these pains are just my chest muscles adjusting to the expanders & I know 2 weeks is not that much time but wondered if others experience these uncomfortable pains as well.  I am not taking percoset anymore as I don't need it during the day and it doesn't seem to alleviate these pains at night.  I see my PS in a few days so will discuss with him but was just curious to hear other's stories....
